Package com.shortn.sally

Interface ObjectConverter

public interface ObjectConverter
Allows the creation of a processor method that will easily convert an object of one type into another.

This interface's only method convert is used by the ShellVerb class for 2 internal methods, convertInt and convertDouble

See Also:
  • ShellVerb

  • Method Summary

    Static Methods
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static <I, O> O
    convert(I in, Function<I,O> action)
    Converts any specified object into a new object of a different specified type, via a defined conversion function.

  • Method Details

    • convert

      static <I, O> O convert(I in, Function<I,O> action)
      Converts any specified object into a new object of a different specified type, via a defined conversion function. This method automatically enters the in parameter to the action parameter's apply method and returns whatever output is generated.
      Type Parameters:
      I - Accepts any object, defines the type to be accepted as input.
      O - Accepts any object, defines the type to be returned as output.
      Parameters:
      in - I object to be input to the function and converted.
      action - Lambda expression (or method call) implementing the Function interface. Must accept an object the same type as I and process it to return an object of type O.
      Returns:
      O object produced as a result of the conversion function.
